programme.title: Wildest India: Ganges: River of Life

programme.title: Wildest Africa: Mount Kenya: African Heart of Ice

programme.desc: Forensic Photography: Forensic photographers are among the first people at a crime scene, capturing vital clues on film. What do the cameras capture that can't be seen first-hand, and who are the men and women who analyze the camera's clues?

programme.title: The New Detectives: Face Of Tragedy

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie thinks his kids have been spending too much time on their phones and other devices so he initiates a "No-Tech Week," but when he has to participate too it ends up being harder than he thought. There's a lice outbreak at Duck Command.

programme.desc: SAR teams go deep for a missing subject in the Upana cave system on Vancouver Island.

programme.title: Divorce Court: Dead Weight
programme.desc: They say opposites attract, but Betty is starting to feel weighed down by David. David is lazy and disrespectful for how broke he is all the time. Betty no longer wants to be tied down by being with someone who is always unemployed and lies about it.

programme.desc: Man blames ex-girlfriend for loss of business, belongings, and child care. Ex-girlfriend accuses him of assault and theft. Woman tries to access ex-boyfriend's bank account for $5,000 surgery bill reimbursement.

programme.title: Judge Judy: Episode 13.146
programme.desc: A man denies popping the tires and smashing the truck windows of his ex-girlfriend’s new boyfriend’s vehicle in a jealous rampage. Ex-lovers accuse each other of having drug problems during a fight over an alleged loan for a motorcycle.

programme.title: Judge Judy: Episode 13.256
programme.desc: A young woman sues ex-business partner for investment return and legal fees. Another sues ex-friend for VW Jetta balance, disputing key handover. Woman sues ex-boyfriend for utility bills, deposit, and debt.

programme.title: Judge Judy: Episode 13.218
programme.desc: A man is allegedly chased out of a bar and viciously attacked after being accused of stealing a woman’s purse. A man hits black ice and has a wreck in his brother’s ex-girlfriend’s car; she sues him for damages.

programme.title: Judge Judy: Episode 13.178
programme.desc: Two women fight at a Halloween party over wearing the same costume, disputing their relationship with the Sheriff’s department. A woman crashes her co-worker's car into oncoming traffic, admitting she was driving without a license.

programme.title: Judge Judy: Episode 13.180
programme.desc: A 66-year-old analyst for the U.S. Department of Defense claims he was intimate with a 27-year-old sports bar worker and that she owes him money. She denies his claims.

programme.title: Judge Judy: Episode 13.232
programme.desc: A man accidentally crashes his date's car while teaching her to drive in the snow, leading to a lawsuit. Divorced parents dispute sharing the cost of their teenager's snowboarding camp trip.

programme.title: Judge Judy: Episode 13.143
programme.desc: Dispute arises from dramatic 911 call of husband mauled by pit bull; family feud ensues. Woman sues daughter’s ex-friends for misusing car purchase funds.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Archipelagos
programme.desc: The romantic notion of island life has always attracted us. Explore the histories, cultures, and unique ways of life on the World’s Greatest Archipelagos - clusters of islands that share common bonds of geography, geology, and genealogy.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Timeless Cities & Towns
programme.desc: These cities and towns are special places where the past coexists with the present, creating cultures totally unique to their people and their part of the world and adhering to ancient traditions and while introducing modern innovations.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Monuments & Landmarks
programme.desc: Many of the world’s most significant manmade wonders serve not as dwellings, but as powerful signposts. But more than giving us direction, they tell us a story - they characterize powerful forces, or commemorate power lost.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Forest Animals
programme.desc: Forest Animals gets up close with bears, koalas, moose, wolves, weaver ants, and Tasmanian Devils. This episode roves dark forests floors and soars above vast canopies of green in America, China, Laos, and Australia.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Rivers
programme.desc: Rivers flow freely - beautiful and powerful waterways that underscore the melody of life. As they meander through the landscape, they shape it, wearing down ranges and deepening valleys, eventually flowing out into the sea.

programme.title: Arthur: D.W. Beats All/Buster the Myth Maker
programme.desc: After the Tibbles get a set of drums to play at the music festival, D.W. is determined to get an even bigger and louder one. Then, Buster is always telling the most incredible stories, but now he claims there is a tiger in the state forest.

programme.title: Arthur: Flippity Francine/Muffy Takes the Wheel
programme.desc: When Muffy posts a goofy video of Francine on the Muffington Post, Francine worries she will become the laughing stock of the entire school. And it's the 1st Annual Lakewood Derby and Muffy's revved up!

programme.title: Arthur: Home Sweet Home/Do You Believe in Magic
programme.desc: It’s time to celebrate summer! Join Arthur as he takes a family vacation and visits Grandpa Dave’s farm. Then, Arthur, D.W. and Buster spend a few days at the beach where they discover the simple joys of building sandcastles!

programme.title: Arthur: The Making of Arthur/Dancing Fools
programme.desc: When Matt Damon puts out a call for homemade videos for his TV show, he sets off a frantic rush as Arthur and his gang film their lives. Mrs. Molina is a teaching a dance class for kids. Will Francine and George be the next Fred and Ginger?

programme.title: Arthur: Binky Vs. Binky/Operation: DW!
programme.desc: Binky may be tough and strong, but when it comes to sports, he always seems to choke. D.W. is having trouble hearing and needs an ear operation. Is it okay to be just a little bit scared?

programme.title: Arthur: Buster Baxter, Cat Saver/Play It Again, D.W.
programme.desc: A cat gets stuck in a tree and Buster Baxter saves the day! Risking life and limb! Next, the ridiculous Crazy Bus song is EVERYWHERE, but mostly it's in the Read's home, because D.W. has to play it 4000 times a day.

programme.title: Arthur: To Eat or Not to Eat/S.W.E.A.T.
programme.desc: A brand-new candy bar is in town! And what exactly is this ingredient called Tri-Enzomated Zorn Jelly, anyway? Then, it's time for the kids at Lakewood Elementary to take the "S.W.E.A.T” test and anxiety is running high.

programme.title: Arthur: So Funny I Forgot to Laugh/The Best Day Ever
programme.desc: Arthur thinks his jokes about Sue Ellen's new sweater are in good fun but Sue Ellen's feelings are hurt. Has Arthur become a bully? Everyone is reminiscing about their "best days." Except Arthurs. Is it possible he doesn't have one?

programme.title: Arthur: The Good Sport/Crushed
programme.desc: When the Athlete of the Year Award doesn't go to Francine, she makes no effort to hide her hurt feelings from the recipient. Arthur can't believe his parents are hiring a babysitter--he's 8 years old, and babysitters are b-o-r-i-n-g!

programme.title: Nazi Collaborators: The Dutch Collaborator
programme.desc: Anton Adriaan Mussert, initially resisted Hitler’s anti-Semitism despite modeling his NSB party, even welcoming Jewish members. His failed attempt to kidnap Queen Wilhelmina led him into hiding, after which he collaborated in hopes of gaining power.

programme.title: Nazi Collaborators: The Jews Who Fought for Hitler
programme.desc: In Hitler’s Germany, those with Jewish ancestry faced harsh Nuremberg Laws. Full Jews faced death; Mischlinge endured discrimination, job bans. Some, like Helmut Schmidt, unaware of heritage, found protectors like Milch in high places.

programme.title: Nazi Collaborators: The Grand Mufti
programme.desc: The controversy surrounding Mohammad Amin al-Husayni, stems from his Nazi collaboration. He recruited Bosnian Muslims and advocated for a Palestinian homeland with Nazi help. His diaries reveal awareness of the Holocaust and anti-Semitic sentiments.

programme.title: Nazi Collaborators: The IRA Conspiracy
programme.desc: During WWII, the IRA's "S Plan" aimed to bomb Britain, drawing German support to weaken the British. "Operation Green" and "Plan Kathleen" envisioned IRA aiding a German invasion of Northern Ireland, but both failed due to bungling and infighting.

programme.title: Nazi Collaborators: The Arajs Kommando
programme.desc: Viktor Arajs, a Latvian, played a significant role in the Holocaust, collaborating with the Nazis to eliminate Jews. Leading the Arajs Kommando, he orchestrated the killings of around 30,000 Jews. Arajs justified his actions as patriotic defense.

programme.title: Catfish UK: Alayah & Tommy
programme.desc: Alayah and Tommy started messaging on a live streaming platform. Alayah thinks he could be the one, but when they try and meet, he keeps cancelling. Nella and Oobah help to track him down. (S2, ep8)

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show: Steven & Samm
programme.desc: Steven is due to graduate high school, instead of planning for college he wants to move to California for his online love, Samm. Steven's mum is sceptical of Samm's identity. (S4, ep10)

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show: Lauren & Derek
programme.desc: Lauren met Derek online years ago. Derek is caring, supporting Lauren after she had a baby with a former boyfriend. Lauren thinks Derek could be the one, so why has he avoided meeting her?

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show
programme.desc: Robin is desperate to meet her hunky, long-distance love in person. Nev and Max agree to help her hunt him down, but what they uncover turns out to be much more than Robin bargained for! (S6, ep17)

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show: Mike & Caroline
programme.desc: Mike fell in love with Caroline online. He grew suspicious when she continually evaded meeting him, yet left notes at his car. Is Caroline an imposter or is she just afraid?

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show
programme.desc: Caitlyn calls on Nev and Max to help separate the fact from fiction of her courtship with Kenton. Kenton insists she and her daughter move to Kentucky but is Kenton all he claims to be? (S6, ep20)

programme.title: The City: Sleeping With The Frenemy
programme.desc: Olivia's working at ELLE Magazine, but meets her match in co-worker Erin Kaplan. Whitney returns to work for Kelly Cutrone, &amp; an old friend's in town, looking to crash with her. (S1, ep14)

programme.title: The City: Working Girls
programme.desc: Whitney wonders if working with a friend is a good idea when Roxy steps out of line on day one. Olivia wins Joe Zee's approval on a new project at ELLE, but Erin isn't impressed. (S1, ep15)

programme.title: The City: Its All Who You Know
programme.desc: Whitney goes behind Kelly's back to show her fashion designs to Bergdorf Goodman. Olivia shocks Erin by using her fashion world connections to succeed at her biggest ELLE task. (S1, ep16)

programme.title: The Hills: An Unexpected Call
programme.desc: Teen Vogue sends Lauren on an over-night errand that lands her in New York City, Heidi learns that work in party promotion isn't just a party, and Audrina looks to Brian for love. (S1, ep3)

programme.title: The Hills: Lauren and Jason: Part 2
programme.desc: When Jason, Lauren's ex flame from Laguna Beach, reappears in her life, Lauren thinks she may not be over him. Meanwhile, Heidi asks if the price of a new job is worth paying for. (S1, ep4)

programme.title: The Hills: Jason's Birthday
programme.desc: After a Teen Vogue event, Lauren hurries to get home to Jason for his birthday. However, things don't end up so well when Jason only wants to hang out with his friends. (S1, ep5)

programme.title: The Hills: Boyfriends and Work Don't Mix
programme.desc: Jason becomes a distraction in Lauren's life, Heidi finally gets her big chance to work in the nightclub, and when a model drops out from a Teen Vogue fashion show, Whitney steps in. (S1, ep6)

programme.title: The Hills: Somebody Always Has to Cry
programme.desc: It's the gang's first holiday in LA but not everyone gets what they wish for. A New Year's kiss is hard to come by for Lauren when Jason learns she got a call from an old flame. (S1, ep7)

programme.title: The City: Meet the Fackelmayers
programme.desc: Whitney meets some cute brothers. Olivia thrives at an ELLE Magazine cocktail party &amp; Erin reminds her that the fashion business isn't just about who you know but what you know. (S1, ep17)

programme.title: The City: Hit It And Quit It
programme.desc: Whitney grows cautious about Freddie just as her ex, Jay, comes back into the picture. Roxy clashes with Olivia when People's Revolution and Elle join forces to put on a party. (S1, ep18)

programme.title: The City: Weekend at Freddie's
programme.desc: On a weekend trip to the Hamptons, Whitney finds out some surprising news about Freddie. Erin has to pick up the slack when Olivia drops the ball on a big interview assignment. (S1, ep19)

programme.title: 48 Hours: Sweetheart Murders
programme.desc: The story of sweethearts Sabrina Gonsalves and John Riggins who were brutally murdered in Davis, California, in 1980. Initially, police suspected Gerald Gallego, but he was in jail at the time of the murders.

programme.title: 48 Hours: A Cop Behind Bars
programme.desc: Patrick Bradford, was convicted of stabbing his mistress to death. Determined to win his acquittal, Deborah Nolan, a close friend, and staunch supporter of Bradford’s, quit her teaching job and went to law school to take on his defense.

programme.title: 48 Hours: Lost in Paradise
programme.desc: In 1976, Deborah Gardner, a Peace Corps worker, was murdered while on assignment in the South Pacific island nation of Tonga. Dennis Priven, a 24-year-old fellow Peace Corps worker, who appeared to be obsessed with Gardner, was charged by Tongan police.

programme.title: 48 Hours: A Daughter, A Mortgage, and Two Murders
programme.desc: A report on the investigation into the murders of Greg and Bernadette Ohlemacher in 2005. The Albuquerque, New Mexico couple had been shot dead in their home

programme.title: 48 Hours: The Babysitter
programme.desc: Chris Routh, a responsible 14-year-old honor student loved children and earned money as a babysitter.. On July 25, 2001, Emily a child in his care suddenly stopped breathing. Was this a case of murder, an accident, or natural causes. Police investigate.

programme.title: 48 Hours: Mystery in Room 813
programme.desc: On November 13, 1996, at a Sheraton hotel east of Los Angeles, 27-year-old Sandra Orellana of Houston, on a business trip with her 33-year-old boss Robert Salazar, went over a balcony and met her death.

programme.title: Garfield & Friends: Stick To It/Orson In Wonderland/For Cats Only
programme.desc: Garfield tells Odie to stay in one spot./During a croquet game Orson finds a large hole./Garfield hosts a special, on KAT TV.

programme.title: Garfield & Friends: The Lasagna Zone/Sleepytime Pig/Yojumbo
programme.desc: When Garfield has an accident on the new satellite antennae, he ends up in the TV./Orson Can't get to sleep./Jon decides to learn karate.

programme.title: Garfield & Friends: Return of the Buddy Bears/Much Ado About Lanolin/Reigning Cats and Dogs
programme.desc: The Buddy Bears help Garfield clean the house./Orson and the gang do an performance of "Taming of the Shrew."/Garfield hosts a TV debate.

programme.title: Garfield & Friends: Mistakes Will Happen/The Well Dweller/The Wise Man
programme.desc: Garfield addresses viewers comments./Orson drills a well for water./Jon follows the advice of a Wise man.

programme.title: Garfield & Friends: Pest of a Guest/Impractical Joker/Fat and Furry
programme.desc: Garfield finds competition from a mangy stray./Roy's jokes become so intolerable, that Orson fires the rooster./Garfield buys a winning lottery ticket and becomes a millionaire.

programme.title: Garfield & Friends: The Binky Show/U.S. Acres: Keeping Cool/Don't Move!
programme.desc: Garfield decides to win Jon a birthday present on a game show./When Orson's brothers come to torment him./Odie must remain outside a pet store.

programme.title: Garfield & Friends: One Good Fern Deserves Another/The Goodie-Go-Round/Health Feud
programme.desc: Jon mistakenly buys a man-eating fern./Orson tries to get a record player for Bo./Jon becomes a health and exercise nut.

programme.title: Garfield & Friends: Garfield and Friends
programme.desc: The Garfield Crime Files examines the cast of the Purse-Snatching Pooches.

programme.title: Garfield & Friends: Lemon Aid/Hog Noon/Video Airlines
programme.desc: Jon wins a free car./A school mate is coming back to settle an old score./Jon decides to go to a video store.

programme.title: Garfield & Friends: First Class Feline/Hamelot/How to be funny
programme.desc: Garfield's plan to send Nermal to Abu Dhabi fails./Orson dreams about the knights of the round table./Garfield lectures on what humor is.

programme.title: Rookie Blue: You Are Here

programme.title: Rookie Blue: Deception

programme.title: My Best Friend's Girl

programme.title: The Babymakers

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob is replacing a potting shed on Mr Beasley’s allotment. In the old shed is a chest which Mr Beasley doesn’t need any more. Meanwhile Wendy calls at JJ’s for the materials for the new shed.

programme.title: Bob the Builder

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: Limbo

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: Motherlode
programme.desc: Augur is caught and placed in a special prison where he is placed in a sensory deprivation chamber. An amoralist gets him out and wants Augur to help him steal the gold Zo'or has on the mothership. When Liam learns of what happened he tries to find Augur.

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: Take No Prisoners

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: The Second Wave

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: Essence
programme.desc: Renee's brother has PTSD. In a desperate effort to help him, she agrees to let him undergo special treatment. The treatment removes his emotion. The project is overseen by Sandoval and the emotion they take is given to Da'an.
